comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Interesting to compare with - www.flickr.com/photos/statelibraryofnsw/3572499330/ . I think this photo is slightly earlier - no wall at the edge of the footpath, no (very early) telephone pole in front of the tree, and no hint of the gas lamp at right. I think it is even earlier than this photo (no footpath wall) - www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/2779685571/

comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content: Yes, you're right...we may need some fashion experts to identify the dress. Victorian? Edwardian?

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: I would say Victorian, and guess about 1897. The building was opened in May 1897 and this southern section completed in 1901. Because the telephone was not yet connected in this photo (!), I would put it nearer 1897. There are a couple of men still working on the roof. History of the AGNSW building (it is not easy to understand!) - www.artgallery.nsw.gov.au/aboutus/history/building

comment.author: 38772536@N03
comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called Sydney in B&W and Monochromatic tones, and we'd love to have this added to the group!
